text: Expression of the chemokine receptor <extra_id_0> BLR2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> EBI1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is specifically transactivated by <extra_id_0> Epstein-Barr virus nuclear antigen 2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

In our attempt to identify chemokine receptors that are related to <extra_id_0> Burkitt's lymphoma receptor 1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> BLR1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) and are expressed in activated lymphocytes we used RT-PCR resulting in the isolation of a cDNA encoding a seven transmembrane receptor termed <extra_id_0> BLR2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

The protein shows significant sequence similarities to the family of G - protein coupled chemokine receptors and turned out to be identical to the recently described receptor <extra_id_0> EBI1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
Northern blot analysis revealed that <extra_id_0> BLR2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA could be highly stimulated in mitogen - and anti-CD3 - treated peripheral blood lymphocytes .
<extra_id_0> BLR2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - specific mRNA could be detected in all Epstein-Barr virus positive B cell lines .

We show that transcription of the <extra_id_0> BLR2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene could be specifically induced in Epstein-Barr virus negative BL 41 cells via estrogen - mediated activation of <extra_id_0> Epstein-Barr virus nuclear antigen 2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , a key regulator of viral and cellular genes in immortalized B cells .
Our data suggest an involvement of <extra_id_0> BLR2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in the regulation of migration in activated lymphocytes and in viral pathogenesis .
